Package Controller

Class AddAppointment

java.lang.Object
Controller.AddAppointment
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AddAppointment extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller that handles the logic for the Add Appointment screen based on addAppointment.fxml.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the Add Appointment window and sets initial values for all fields.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - - not used
      resourceBundle - - not used

    • validateInput

      private boolean validateInput()
      Validates the data entered into the add appointment fields. If any field is found invalid, the user is alerted via a custom notification from the Alerts class, populated with the provided string to explain the error.
      Returns:
      boolean b; false if information is not valid, true if it is.

    • validateTime

      private boolean validateTime()
      Validates times chosen for appointment start and end do not overlap. Generates an alert if overlap is found.
      Returns:
      boolean b - false if overlaps found, true if no overlaps

    • validateCustomer

      private boolean validateCustomer()
      Checks to see if the customer entered for the appointment actually exists. Provides an alert from the Alerts class if the customer does not exist. INCLUDES LAMBDA - streams all customers list, checking each to see if any ID is a match for the chosen ID. This is more concise than running the same comparison using a for loop.
      Returns:
      boolean b; returns false if customer does not exist, true if the customer is found.

    • onSaveButton

      public void onSaveButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Method to handle saving the new appointment.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Used to identify the window from which the save was triggered to close it on a successful execution.

    • onCancel

      public void onCancel(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Confirms that the user wants to cancel adding the new appointment by providing an alert from the Alerts class.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed to a method in the Alerts class; used to close the window if the user confirms they want to close without saving.
